_header: We been executors of this deed
Note:
The same story is found in a sermon in Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Ii.3.8, f. 74v, printed Erb (1971)
XErb, Peter C. “Vernacular Material for Preaching in MS Camb. Univ. Lib. Ii.III.8.” Mediaeval Studies 33 (1971): 63-84, 77-8.
Subjects: inscriptions; executors, criticism of; sermons, verse in; translations
_description: On false executors, a tag in the Fasciculus morum — 6 lines translating French verse inscriptions cited in a story about a rich cleric.

Bod187.First Lines:
We ben assecuteres of þys dedebut of thys mony wat ys
                    ȝowr rede…
Bod187.Last Lines:
…By vs owr dyner wo so wulthe dede schal quyten al the
                    fulle

Bod410.First Lines:
We ben executours of þis dedeNow of þis money what is our
                    rede…
Bod410.Last Lines:
…bye vs our dyner who so wolleþe dede shal qwyte for all
                    þe folle
Bod410.Note: Without French verses; written as prose.

BodLauMis568.First Lines:
We bene assecutours of þys dedeBot of þys money what ys
                    ȝoure rede…
BodLauMis568.Last Lines:
…Bynd owre dyuer ho so wulleþe ded chall qwyte all at
                    þe ful

BodLauMis111.First Lines:
We ben ex asse cutours of þis dedebot of þis monay wat is
                    oure rede…
BodLauMis111.Last Lines:
…Secundus
                    Tak to þe and I to meþe dede kepeth of no moneTercius by vs
                    oure dyner wo so woleþis þe dede schal quyten al þe
                    fulle

BodRawB190.First Lines:
But of þis mone what is oure redeTake to þe and I to
                    me…
BodRawB190.Last Lines:
…Þe dede
                    kepes of no moneBy vs oure dyner who so wolÞe dede schal quyten
                    al þe fulle
BodRawB190.Editions:
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 79-80.

CamGon71.First Lines:
We ben executours of þis dedebot of þe money what is
                    ȝour rede…
CamGon71.Last Lines:
…Byse our dyner who so willþe dede schal quite all
                    þe full

CamGon364.First Lines:
We ben executouris of þis deedebut of þis mony qwat is
                    yowre rede…
CamGon364.Last Lines:
…bryngyth oure deyne qwan ȝe weleþe deede it schal
                    qwytin as it is skele

CamStJohn159.First Lines:
We ben secturs of þe dedebot of þis mony what ys your
                    reyde…
CamStJohn159.Last Lines:
…By vs our diner who so wyllþe dede sall whit all at
                    þe full

Spalding.Transcription:
We the executours of þe dedebot of this monye what is your
                    redeTake to þeand I to meþe dede kepes no monyeByes
                    oure dyner who so wyllþe deyd shall pay for euer deyle
Spalding.Note:
Three separate couplets, each introduced by ‘Primus’,
                    ‘Secundus’, and ‘Tercius’; written as
                    prose.

WorcF19.First Lines:
We ben assecutoris of is dedeBot of þe monay wat ys þy
                    rede…
WorcF19.Last Lines:
…He ys oure dyuer wo so
                    wyllþis dede sall quyte all þe full
WorcF19.Note: Partly written as verse but line divisions confusing.
